alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 4:04AM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Cheyenne and eastern Kimball Counties through 345 AM MDT... At 303 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Kimball Airport to 16 miles northwest of North Sterling Reservoir to near Westplains. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sidney, Kimball, Potter, Dix, Gurley, Brownson, Lorenzo, Kimball Airport and Sidney Airport. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 14 and 64. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
